Contributor: Perry, Raymond, artist.; Victory Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Signed "Raymond Perry." Date based on date of the Victory Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for the Victory Liberty Loan campaign.  The text tells the story of Oscar F. Miller, Major, who died in the line of duty and inspired his men by his courage. People owe it to Major Miller and the others who were killed in France to subscribe to the Victory Liberty Loan. Illustration shows the Major on the ground leading his command group forward.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.

Title: America's immortals : Oscar F. Miller.
